data.title: Chance the Rapper Is Headlining a Music Festival With Mary J. Blige and Nas
data.meta_description: Read about Chance the Rapper's upcoming shows, including a festival he's headlining with Mary J. Blige and Nas.
data.text:
Chance the Rapper is making concert moves this year!

The Voice Coach will be headlining an upcoming music festival called The Blue Note Jazz Festival this July. Other performers include Mary J Blige, Nas, Ari Lennox, Gary Clark Jr., and more. Read about all the details, below.

What is the Blue Note Jazz Festival?

Per the festival's website, "With jazz at its vibrant core, the Blue Note Jazz Festival brings the biggest names in music and culture to the most intimate, small-town setting."

How do I get tickets to the Blue Note Jazz Festival?

Tickets go on sale Friday, April 7 and can be purchased here.

When is the Blue Note Jazz Festival?

The California version of this year's Blue Note Jazz Festival will take place July 28, 29, and 30, 2023.

Chance the Rapper's Norman, Oklahoma free concert

Chance the Rapper is also performing a free concert in Oklahoma this April to support a faith-based, student-led nonprofit organization at the University of Oklahoma. The concert will take place at the Gaylord Family-Oklahoma Memorial Stadium and will be held on April 29, 2023, at 7 p.m. ET.

The show's mission is to be "an event that brings people together for a concert and gospel proclamation on OU’s campus," according to OU Daily.

Tickets for the concert can be purchased in advance here.

Chance the Rapper is currently making his mark as a new Coach on The Voice for Season 23. In a recent interview with TODAY, he opened up about his mentorship techniques and his personal mission as to why he chose to be on the show.

“My main goal on being on the show is trying to help the other Artists bring themselves out of their performances. I wanna give people the opportunity to show their identity, to tell their story through song. It's not so much about turning them into an Artist but just giving them a platform to be themselves, sing the songs they grew up listening to, really just present themselves fully," he explained.

He also gave some details about his upcoming album. “The Star Line Gallery has been well underway. I started it off when I first traveled to Ghana last year, and I met with some of the top contemporary Artists, painters, sculptors, all types of different visual Artists in the world and started creating connections overseas with Artists in Jamaica, and Artists on the continent, and we basically come together and create new pieces,” he said.
